bibl.title: In the matter of the application of George W. Anderson for a writ of Habeas Corpus. Return.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle for King County
In the matter of the application of George W. Anderson for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Honorable C.H. Hanford, Chief Justice of the Territory of Washington, and Judge of the District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory
The petition of George W. Anderson respectfully shows: That your petitioner is imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by John H. McGraw J.C. Mitchell + John. H. McGraw

That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement, and restraint, on illegal; and that the illegality thereof coexists in this to wit that said confinement and detention is without due process of law. That your petitioner is about to be
